extendedIngredients.name: bok choy
extendedIngredients.original: 1 large bunch of bok choy, stems removed and discarded

title: Dinner Tonight: Bok Choy with Ginger and Garlic
summary: Dinner Tonight: Bok Choy with Ginger and Garlic is a gluten free, dairy free, and pescatarian recipe with 2 servings. One portion of this dish contains around 8g of protein, 4g of fat, and a total of 104 calories. For $1.53 per serving, this recipe covers 28% of your daily requirements of vitamins and minerals. 1 person has made this recipe and would make it again. A mixture of bok choy, sesame oil, soy sauce, and a handful of other ingredients are all it takes to make this recipe so delicious. From preparation to the plate, this recipe takes around 45 minutes. All things considered, we decided this recipe deserves a spoonacular score of 88%. This score is excellent. Try Garlic Ginger Zucchini Noodle Bowl with Salmon and Bok Choy, Bok Choy, Shiitake, and Garlic Noodles, and Dinner Tonight: Steamed Salmon with Garlic and Ginger for similar recipes.
instructions: Procedures                                                                              1                                                                            Cook the bok choy leaves in a large pot of boiling water for 5 minutes.  Drain in a colander.                                                                                                                              2                                                                            Meanwhile, pour the toasted sesame oil in a skillet and turn the heat to medium-low.  Add the garlic and ginger and cook for 8 minutes.  Pour in the oyster sauce and cook for another 30 seconds.                                                                                                                             3                                                                            Pour the sauce over the bok choy and serve.

steps.step: Cook the bok choy leaves in a large pot of boiling water for 5 minutes.
Meanwhile, pour the toasted sesame oil in a skillet and turn the heat to medium-low.
Add the garlic and ginger and cook for 8 minutes.
Pour in the oyster sauce and cook for another 30 seconds.
Pour the sauce over the bok choy and serve.
